Pilot.name: Innokenty Gilyov
Pilot.Background: Hailing from a small village near Omsk, Innokenty Gilyov had never seen an aircraft up close until enlisting. He spent his early years hunting with his grandfather and helping maintain farming tools. After reading articles about Soviet aces in Pravda, he became inspired to serve as a pilot. When German troops approached Stalingrad, several of his relatives were displaced, which fueled his desire to act. Though inexperienced, Innokenty Gilyov brought determination and a deep connection to the land.
